boardrelated

Class deedSquare

  • java.lang.Object
    • boardrelated.Square
      • boardrelated.buyableSquare
        • boardrelated.deedSquare
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Auctionable

    public class deedSquare
extends buyableSquare
    This class as the sub-type of buyableSquares allows us progress in a manner that the users can buy deed squares and in addition to that build some houses, hotels and skyscrapers on. It allows us to use a declared behavior of house, hotel and skyscraper properties in many different ways such as the different rent policies under different conditions.
    Author:
    Cem Uyuk

      • deedSquare

        public deedSquare(java.lang.String name,
                  int squareNumber,
                  int trackNumber,
                  int colorID,
                  int totalPlayers,
                  int price,
                  int rent,
                  int house1Rent,
                  int house2Rent,
                  int house3Rent,
                  int house4Rent,
                  int hotelRent,
                  int skyScraperRent,
                  int buildingCost)
        This is the constructor of deedSquare class. It creates instances of the class.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the square.
        squareNumber - The number of the square which is sort of tag.
        trackNumber - Number of the track that this class' instance is on.
        colorID - Color Identification number of this class' instance.
        totalPlayers - The number of total players on its instance.
        price - The cost of this class' instance.
        rent - The rent amount of the deed.
        house1Rent - Rent cost of 1 house.
        house2Rent - Rent cost of 2 houses.
        house3Rent - Rent cost of 3 houses.
        house4Rent - Rent cost of 4 houses.
        hotelRent - Rent cost of a hotel.
        skyScraperRent - Rent cost of a skyscraper.
        buildingCost - The cost of building any structure.

      • getItPaid

        public void getItPaid(Player p,
                      int amount,
                      Game g)
        This method transfers some amount of money from the input player to another by the input amount.
        Parameters:
        p - Player who takes place in the payment process.
        amount - Amount of money to be transferred from the arriving player to the deed owner.
        g - The game in which the player p and the deed exist.

      • getWorthHelper

        public int getWorthHelper(int cases)
        This method gives out the total worth of a deedSquare instance by taking an input integer ranging from 1 to 4. This integer describes the current situation of the deed. This means if the deed has some houses or not and even hotels and skyscrapers.
        Parameters:
        cases - To let know what is the current situation on the deedSquare instance.
        Returns:
        The total amount of worth of a deedSquare instance.
        Requires:
        The input integer to range from 1 to 4.

      • getRecWorth

        public int getRecWorth()

        Returns:
        The total recievable worth of a deedSquare.
        See Also:

      • arrival_proc

        public void arrival_proc(Player p,
                         Game g)
        This method applies the proper process to the arriving player to the deed square. It deducts half of the amount if the player chooses the Comped Room option.
        Overrides:
        arrival_proc in class Square
        Parameters:
        p - Player who just arrived on the deed square.
        g - Game in which the arriving player and the deed square exist.
        See Also:
        Square.arrival_proc(backend.Player, backend.Game)
        Requires:
        A player to land on it., Another player to own the place.
        Modifies:
        Increases the balance of the owner player., Decreases amount of money that the arriving player., The card deck of the arriving player, if the he/she uses comped room card.

      • canRemove

        public boolean canRemove(int cases)
        This method decreases the structure level of a deedSquare by 1. To be more specific, if there are if there is a hotel, it lowers to the level that 4 houses exist, if this method is called upon 4 houses, the number of houses go down to 3, and so on.
        Parameters:
        cases - The integer number that describes what is asked to removed.
        Returns:
        True if the owner of this deedSquare's instance can remove some structure out
        Requires:
        The deedSquare to have some sort of structure on it., All the color group to be on the same construction level or 1 higher or 1 lower.
        Modifies:
        The constructions on the deedSquare instance which called this method upon

      • canBuild

        public boolean canBuild(int cases)
        This method checks if a player can build on a deedSquare. If yes, it returns true. To be more specific, input 1 checks if a player can build a house, 2 a hotel and so on.
        Parameters:
        cases - The integer number that describes what is asked to build.
        Returns:
        True if a player can build on it.
        Requires:
        The owner to have enough balance., The color group to be owned by the same player and be in the same construction level.

      • levelBool

        public boolean levelBool()
        This method lets know if a color group is on the same level or 1 higher.
        Returns:
        True if the color group is on the same construction level or only 1 difference in levels. To be more specific, levels follow as: number of houses, hotel, skyscraper.

      • levelBoolForRemove

        public boolean levelBoolForRemove()
        This method checks the level of construction in a color group for removal. If it returns true, then it means a construction is removable from the deedSquare
        Returns:
        True if the color group is in the same level or 1 less which allow the deconstruction.
